Hello @Ivn_Escudero66 

Only extend what the FDP shows and manage grouping within the template. If you require data not available through the FDP, consider raising an influence/incident or creating a custom app and form for your needs.

You can refer to the useful SAP documentation below.

SAP Help: Creating Data Source Extensions and Output Extensibility features you can add to forms. SAP Help Portal

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: #CoE#OTMC Zscaler and SAP Router
entry.content:
Hi there

We use SAP Router to manage our connection between SuccessFactors in the Public Cloud and SAPGUI, which our technical support team use.  SAP Router is in an EC2 instance in our AWS tenancy. 

We are now looking at moving SAP Router to an Azure Virtual Machine which is protected by Zscaler.  I've looked online and there is nothing about how SAP Router and Zscaler can work together.  What there is online refers to Zscaler Private Network supplanting SAP Router but there is a lack of clarity around how that would work with SAPGUI given that SAP have private protocols authenticating SAP Router and SAP GUI.

Regardless I would be very grateful if anyone could provide some advice on their experience migrating SAP Router into an environment protected by Zscaler Zero-Trust policies, and whether it's even possible.  I do appreciate that this is quite an edge case, but I'm hoping that someone has run into this before and can help me out.

entry.title: Error in an SAP Integration Suite integration
entry.content:
Hello, good afternoon.
We encountered an error when trying to run an integration included in the Mexico Document Compliance Generic package. The problem is that when we add an example XML with fictitious values, we don"t have a PAC configured yet and want to simulate a response and test these integrations.
The error is in the mapping between the input XML and the configured XSD.
The error is the following: com.sap.aii.mappingtool.tf7.IllegalInstanceException: Cannot produce target element /ns3:PACResponse. Queue has not enough values â€‹â€‹in context. Target XSD requires a value for this element, but target field mapping does not produce one. Probably the XML-instance is not valid for the source XSD, or the target field mapping does not meet the requirement of the target XSD. on the exchange: Exchange[03B9D4CF234F9BE-0000000000000003]

Thank you very much for the support

Regards, Christopher Rivas

entry.title: Re: Free Good Processing (BKA) Scope Item is not working...
entry.content:
Hello @yv4dng2 

This is expected behaviour in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: for scope item BKA â€“ Free Goods Processing, the system does not generate a separate free-goods line. Instead, it applies a 100% discount (condition D100) to the qualifying item. SAP confirms that BKA does not involve â€œadditional item generation.â€ SAP Support Portal-2822952 - Free Goods Processing does not generate a separate free goods item

Quick checks

Ensure that Free Goods Determination is enabled in your configuration and that your condition record is valid for the specific sales area, material, UoM, and validity dates. SAP Help-free trade 

Maintain/verify records in Manage Free Goods

If you need a separate free line

Use BDA for free delivery with a dedicated order type; this ensures that the line item becomes free via D100 in the pricing procedure. This process generates deliverable items at no cost, with the option of a pro forma or zero invoice.SAP Learning-Understanding Free of Charge Delivery Process

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Issues with SAP Practical test module of SAP S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hi @OlanrewajuBello 

Based on your screenshot, the unresponsive page is usually due to either browser compatibility or a stuck tenant session.

Maybe try using another browser (Chrome or Edge), make sure to clear your cache and re-login. You may also consider incognito or private mode. Avoid VPN or firewall restrictions.

Chris

entry.title: Re: Issues with SAP Practical test module of SAP S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @OlanrewajuBello 

This appears to be the SAP Learning Practice System. When the page remains frozen on task 1, itâ€™s usually a browser, session, pop-up, or cookie issue.

Begin by restarting the practice system via the Practice Systems tile using Resume/Reset, then launch it again from that point.

Use Chrome/Edge Incognito mode and enable pop-ups and third-party cookies for the learning/S4 domains. Some CBC/SSCUIs open in a new pop-up and may be blocked. SAP Support Portal-3251919 - UI5 web browser error appears during configuration in CBC

Perform a hard refresh / clear cache and try again classic Fiori Launchpad troubleshooting SAP Help Portal-SAP Fiori App Cannot Be Opened

If it continues to freeze, submit a ticket to SAP Learning Support via the Learning Help Center â†’ Practice systems support, and include your screenshot, time, and system ID.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Synchronous Goods Receipt
entry.content:
Hello @VickiG1 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Manufacturing Order Type, Integration Scenario with EWM & EWM Synchronous Goods Movement

Yes, you are correct. To enable synchronous Goods Receipt and Goods Issue you only need to update your Order-Type dependent parameters.

Make sure your WM request field is set to No Creation of Transfer Requirements because synchronous posting eliminates the need for separate requests.

You do not need to customise in EWM but make sure your bin mapping and stock type settings are correct. The implications are that inbound deliveries and warehouse tasks are no longer created, postings happen immediately during confirmation and process become faster but are less transparent. Which in place handles errors stricter.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Not able to find API for " SALES QUOTATION SIMULATE"...
entry.content:
Hello @S0027059815 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Sales Quotations API, Simulate Creation of Sales Order & Sales Quotation for more details.

To summarise, there is no released API for Sales Quotation Simulate in public cloud. You have the option to use the Sales Quotation OData API but this only enables you to create, read, update or delete and not simulate.

I recommend you use the Sales Order Simulate API because it provides simulated pricing, taxed and conditions without persisting the order. You can also pass the same input data you would use for quotation.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hello @FabianSCC 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Output Management & Configuring Dunning and Outputs for details.

In summary, based on the details you provided, the issue seems not to be with the Exclusive Indicator but with the condition in your second row.

You should keep default email address = is not initial, channel = email, exclusive Indicator = X for the email row. You are required to set default email address = is initial, channel = print.

Without the condition in the second row, the system cannot differentiate and will not print in the fallback case.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAPS4PC -BAdI for Updating Custom Field During PO Cre...
entry.content:
Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Extensibility, App Extensibility: Manage Purchase Orders & https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/044700714fc54863b7fa9ea0b5654ba0.html?locale=en-US

To summarise, the MM_PUR_S4_PO_ITEM_MAP is the suitable enhancement spot and it allows you to map custom fields from your source documents such as contract to the PO item. Alternatively, MM_PUR_S4_PO_ITEM can also be used if you need to enrich values in the PO item directly.

You can achieve this by creating your own custom field and enable it for both contract item and PO item. Thereafter, implement the BAdI in CFL and do the necessary mapping. You can test it by creating a PO with reference to a contract.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Print SES - Service Entry Sheets from Purchase Orders
entry.content:
Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Service Entry Sheet, S/4HANA Cloud Output Management - Purchase Order & Custom Form Template for more details.

To summarise, service receipts do not have a standard print form delivered like material receipts in public cloud. The message you received appears because you cannot reuse the material receipt output formats directly for ESOA. To enable printing, you will need to:

  • Make use of the Output parameter determination with the service entry sheet category.
  • You can either use a delivered output type for SES or create your won custom form template and assign it to ESOA.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: RAP Behavior extension of Production Order
entry.content:
Hello @swedish23 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at App Extensibility in Production Operations, Extensibility: Production Order Confirmation & RAP On-Stack Developer Extensibility for more details.

To summarise, although the BO is extensible, public cloud does not support all RAP features in behaviour extension.  You received the error because determination on save is not allowed in BO extensions. Public cloud currently supports validations, action and field control.

If you need to influence production order field values, I recommend you use released BadIs. Alternatively, you can also use CFL to enrich values. SAP BTP side-by-side extensibility offers you options for complex defaults, and you can update orders through released APIs.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Request to Update Default Login in Universal ID
entry.content:
Please use the S-user ID instead of the email address to log in. If logged in with an email address, the default S-user will be the one used to log in to SAP ID Service.

For several S-users linked with the same email address, to change the default login S-user: 
1. Access SAP ID Service.
2. Click 'Log Out'.
3. Log in again using the desired S-user ID. 
4. After successfully changing, the updated S-user will appear first.

Detail information please refer to KBA 3650023 - Unable to Select Linked Accounts After Logging into SAP for Me with Universal ID - SAP Universal ID (UID)

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytic Cloud has really limited functionalities...
entry.content:
Hi,

you have raised some very practical points. Many of us who have used Power BI or Tableau notice the same differences when we start working in SAC. Let me share my view in short.

 

ğŸ”¹ Linked Dimension Limitation

You are right, in SAC the linked dimension must appear in the widget, otherwise the relationship does not work.
This is because SAC treats it as front-end blending, not as a semantic model join like Power BI.

 

ğŸ”¹ Calculations

SAC is stricter between measures and dimensions.
For complex logic (sum, avg, count, conditions like Sales > 100), you need Restricted/Calculated measures in the model.

 

ğŸ”¹ Data Models in Stories vs Data Analyzer

Stories are limited to prepared models, so flexibility feels less compared to Power Pivot.
The Data Analyzer allows more OLAP-style exploration, but it is separate from the Story environment.

 

ğŸ”¹ Where SAC is Stronger

  • SAC ensures consistent governance: calculations and joins are controlled in the model layer, avoiding ad-hoc mismatches.
  • Integration with BW/HANA means business rules and hierarchies are reused directly, unlike Power BI/Tableau where relationships are defined outside the ERP.
  • This approach gives trusted numbers for finance and costing teams, even if flexibility is less for ad-hoc slicing.

 


So yes, SAC feels more rigid compared to Power BI or Tableau, but the trade-off is stronger control, governance, and trusted data when you are working with enterprise systems like BW and S4. It depends on whether you value flexibility or consistency more for your use case.

entry.title: Re: SAC Waterfall Custom Hierarchy Dimension
entry.content:
Hello, thanks for raising this point.

Hierarchy Activation in Model
When you create a custom hierarchy in SAC (like YearMonth), you must first ensure it is enabled in the model. Open the model, go to the Calendar Month dimension, and check if your custom hierarchy is listed and marked as active.

Hierarchy Usage in Story
In the story, after selecting Calendar Month, use the â€œâ€¦â€ (more options) menu on the chart axis to switch from Flat Presentation to your YearMonth hierarchy. If not switched, the output will look flat even if hierarchy exists.

Validation Step
Also confirm that your hierarchy has at least two levels (for example, Year â†’ Month). If it is a single-level group, SAC will not visually change the chart output.

Hope this helps clarify where to enable and apply the hierarchy. This small step often resolves such display issues quickly.

entry.title: Unleashing Creativity with Cloud-Based AI Apps: 2025 Premium Hub CoE High School Summer Orientation
entry.content:
This summer, a group of bright high school students embarked on an exciting journey at SAP's week-long STEM orientation program. This program focused on harnessing the power of cloud-based AI apps using the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), providing students with practical, hands-on learning experiences using low-code/no-code tools.

 

 

Building the Foundation with SAP Build Apps:

The week kicked off with students getting an introduction into SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and Artificial Intelligence at SAP. A key component of the learning experience was SAP Build Apps, a powerful tool within SAP BTP that enabled students to design and develop applications using a low-code/no-code approach. This tool simplified the app creation process, allowing students to focus on functionality and creativity rather than complex coding.

The primary task was to create a barcode scanner application using SAP Build Apps. This app scanned barcodes and retrieved detailed information about food items from the Open Food Facts API, a free and open database of food product information. This integration taught students how to connect their applications to external data sources, demonstrating the potential of combining SAP BTP with other digital resources.

Adding a Generative AI Twist:

The real magic happened when students were introduced to Google Gemini, allowing them to enhance their applications with Generative AI capabilities. By integrating AI into their apps, students were able to analyze the health aspects of food ingredients, transforming simple barcode scanners into intelligent, interactive applications. This exercise encouraged students to think critically about how AI can enhance user experiences and provide valuable insights.

Showcasing Innovation:

As the week progressed, students eagerly worked on their projects, each bringing their own flair to the task. They showcased the culmination of their hard work in a demo session held on Friday, presenting their enhanced applications. It was inspiring to see how each participant leveraged the tools and guidance provided to create something truly remarkable.

Reflecting on the Experience:

The orientation week was not just about building apps; it was about fostering a spirit of innovation and collaboration. The students left with more than just technical skills; they gained confidence and a deeper understanding of how technology can be used to solve real-world problems.

The feedback from participants has been overwhelmingly positive, with many expressing how the program has sparked a new interest in technology and AI.

Here's what one of our students had to say about their unforgettable experience:

â€œThank you so much for organizing such a great practicum experience at SAP. I really enjoyed the week and learned a lot, especiallyâ€during the project work and all the tours. Getting to explore the SAP Build platform and contribute to the barcode scanner project was a really cool experience, and it helped me understand how tech is used in the real world.

I also really appreciated how friendly and supportive everyone was throughout the week. The tours of the MCC and Smart Factory, as well as the leadership talk on the last day, were really inspiring and gave me a better idea of the kinds of roles I might want to explore in the future.

Thanks again for the opportunity, and Iâ€™m really grateful for the experience!â€- Mehul Vijayvergiya

 

Looking Forward:

This orientation was a testament to the power of education and technology in shaping the minds of tomorrow's innovators. As we continue to provide these opportunities, we are excited to see how these young minds will contribute to the ever-evolving tech landscape.

 

Thank you toâ€¯Balaji Rao Gaddamâ€¯for sponsoring and hosting this yearâ€™s event.  

Thank you to the SAP colleagues who coordinated this yearâ€™s Summer Orientation and made it a success!

 

Ashok Kumar M & Megan Rech (Leads) Nkem Ohanenye (Project Co-Coordinator), Savannah Cole (HR) and volunteers and speakers. A huge thank you to our onsite team coordinators Nkem Ohanenye, Sean David, Prasad Gagarani, and Manas Trivedi.


And a special thanks to the SAP speakers and colleagues who shared their expertise!
John Astill (D-Shop Demo), Evan Taylor (STAR Internship Program), Justin Lynch (SAP Overview & Career Development), George Harwood (NSQ Campus Tour), Haibo Huang & Vivek RR (Artificial Intelligence Experts), SooWan Bag and Peter Yeung (Industry 4.0 Center Tour), Manuel Gruber, Julia Cuellar, Rob, Bulusu, Hubertus Oswald (MCC Presentation).

 

#STEM #PremiumHubCoE

entry.title: Re: Indonesia Billing & IV with Down Payment, down paymen...
entry.content:
Check this SAP Help document Down Payment and Down Payment Request 

Key points from this page:

  • You can define down payment categories (mandatory, voluntary, not active) at PO header or item level.
  • When you post an incoming invoice in MIRO, the system proposes all down payments that were posted with reference to the PO and not yet cleared.
  • The system then posts a down payment clearing document together with the invoice document.
  • This ensures that the final invoice amount is reduced by the down payment amount.

Could you please check the expression-based filter is correctly maintained in the Custom CDS View.

If you have an element and selected for the expression-based filter to filter by company code, account type for the custom cds view, check those fields has been maintained correctly with correct field name. 

Replace I_JournalEntryOperationalView with an actual column name (Company Code, Account Type fields).

For example:

If you were trying to use the Account Type from that view, your entry should look like:
I_JournalEntryOperationalView.FinancialAccountType (Assuming Account Type is a field in the target view)

You need to treat I_JournalEntryOperationalView as a view that you associate to, not a column you select.

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Meets Multi-Tenancy
entry.content:
Introduction

Multitenancy with SAP Build Work Zone - Managed App Router in CEP (Central Entry Point) Modeâ€‹

â€‹Since the introduction of the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment, managing multitenant applications through the Central Launchpad Service, known as SAP Build Work Zone, has been a significant and continuous challenge.

â€‹As an alternative, multitenant solutions had to rely on the Portal Service supported via a standalone app router.Managing this standalone app router at the individual project or product level to meet all security and compliance standards was a cumbersome task.â€‹

â€‹This approach increased the cost of development and maintenance.â€‹

â€‹With SAP Build Work Zone's support for multitenancy, we can now leverage the out-of-the-box feature benefits of the Managed App Router.â€‹

â€‹Projects and products can shift their focus and energy towards actual business operations.

Pros:â€‹

  • Standard Support for Managed App Routerâ€‹
  • Easier Maintenance of Security and Reduced Development/Maintenance Effortsâ€‹
  • Alignment with One SAP Approach aka Golden Path, Providing a Single-Entry Point for End Users/Customersâ€‹
  • With CDM (Common Data Model) Support, Site and Content Maintenance Becomes Simplifiedâ€‹
  • Best fitment for SAP-managed subaccount for end customers.

Cons:â€‹

  •  In the SAP Managed Solution, an SAP Build Work Zone subscription is a prerequisite in the subscriber subaccount.â€‹

Step-by-Step Guide/Walkthrough of SBWZ in Multitenant Account in CEP Mode

â¢ Build Time Activity - Site Content Creation via CDM.json

â¢ Easy Maintenance of Site Config, Page/Space, Group/Catalogs

â¢ Translation of site content Texts Group, Page/Space via i18n

â¢ appId=> sap.app.id mentioned in the manifest.json file

â¢ vizId => cross navigation semantic object action in the manifest.json

â¢ Add Common Data Model (CDM) as part of MTA Build

â¢ Define Common Data Model (CDM) destination â€“ Identified by Business Solution Name defined in

manifest.json â€œsap.cloudâ€->â€œserviceâ€

â¢ Define runtime destination for launchpad content

â¢ Build the MTA application and deploy to the BTP provider subaccount.

â¢ Verify the CDM and runtime destination in provider sub-account

â¢ Export the destination

â¢ Subscriber subaccount -> subscribe to the multitenant application

â¢ Import the CDM & run time destination in subscriber subaccount

â¢ CDM destination in subscriber subaccount, update client secret reference from provider subaccount.

â¢ Runtime destination changes the URL to point to the subscriber subaccount subdomain.

â¢ Subscriber subaccount -> SAP Build Work Zone subscription/entitlement should be there

â¢Create a content channel in the subscriber subaccount Site Manager -> Content Channels by using the imported RT (runtime) and CDM (design time) destination.

â¢ Once it is created, refresh it to reflect the site content in the subscriber subaccount.

â¢ In Subscriber subaccount BTP cockpit map, the Role Collection [created by content channel] to Technical Role

â¢ Assign the CIS/IAS user Group to Role Collection

 

â¢ In Site Manager, a site is created automatically after channel creation/refresh

Configuring Multiple UI5 Apps in a Single Site Using CDM.json [CDM Merge] in CEP Mode

â¢ Add the CDM file in your second UI5 app, having the same site ID but different groups, catalogs and roles.

â¢ Keep the business solution name the same in manifest.json file

â¢Deploy the app, subscribe, re-import destinations, update roles, and refresh the content channel. The site stays the same, but "Go to Site" shows all groups and catalogs.

entry.title: Re: Multiple Functional Modules
entry.content:
If you expand from SD into TM (Transportation Management), EWM (Extended Warehouse Management), and GTS (Global Trade Services):

Advantages

  • You become an endâ€‘toâ€‘end logistics process expert: from order capture (SD) â†’ warehouse operations (EWM) â†’ transportation planning (TM) â†’ crossâ€‘border compliance (GTS).
  • High demand: Many S/4HANA transformation projects look for consultants who can bridge across these modules instead of hiring 3â€“4 separate specialists.
  • Strong career branding: â€œSAP Logistics Consultantâ€ is a premium niche, especially in manufacturing, retail, automotive, and global supply chain industries.
  • Youâ€™ll be closer to business process consulting and solution architecture roles.

Challenges

  • Steep learning curve: Each module is deep in its own right.
  • Youâ€™ll need to prioritize (e.g., SD + EWM first, then TM, then GTS).
  • Requires strong clientâ€‘facing and requirements gathering skills, since logistics processes are highly crossâ€‘functional.


If you add ABAP to your SD expertise:

Advantages

  • You can design solutions and also prototype/customize them yourself.
  • Youâ€™ll bridge the gap between functional and technical teams, which makes you very valuable in smaller or fastâ€‘moving projects.
  • Easier to move into solution architect or product owner roles later, since you understand both business and system internals.

Challenges

  • Youâ€™ll be competing with career ABAP developers who have much deeper coding experience.
  • The market increasingly values functional consultants with integration knowledge over functional consultants who â€œalso code.â€
  • You may risk being seen as â€œjack of all tradesâ€ unless you position yourself carefully.

Having said that, if you ask me how to decide, if your passion is business processes, supply chain, and logistics, go the multiâ€‘module functional route. If you enjoy system logic, debugging, and technical design, and want to be the bridge between business and IT, go technoâ€‘functional. Given you already have 7 years in SD, the natural progression is to expand horizontally into logistics modules. Thatâ€™s where your experience compounds fastest.

entry.title: How to Track Data Changes in RAP and Change Log Mechanism in RAP.
entry.content:
hi, 

A change log table alone can be used to track data modifications without storing full historical snapshots. The main table contains the active business data, while the change log table records only the metadata of each change, such as the key fields of the affected record, change type (insert, update, delete), user, and optionally the reason for change.  

 During the RAP save sequence, determinations in the behavior implementation capture these details before the transaction is committed and insert them into the change log table. This approach provides a lightweight audit trail that allows you to track when and by whom changes were made, making it suitable for compliance monitoring, reporting, and troubleshooting, while avoiding the storage overhead of a shadow table that keeps the full data history. 

 

Here we see some major key Advantages. 

  • Lower Storage Requirements â€“ Since it stores only metadata (keys, change type, timestamp, user, etc.) instead of full data snapshots, it uses significantly less database space than a shadow table. 
  • Better Performance â€“ Writing smaller log entries reduces the impact on transaction performance compared to saving entire records. 
  • Simplified Design â€“ Only one additional table is needed, making the data model and maintenance simpler. 
  • Faster Reporting on Changes â€“ The log contains concise, relevant details, making it easier to query and generate audit reports. 
  • Regulatory Compliance â€“ Still fulfills many compliance and audit requirements by showing who changed what and when. 

Steps to achieving  the Track Change Log Mechanism in RAP. 

I have create 2 database tables  

  1. For basic details 
  1. Capturing the changes record table 

 

Table 2.

 

 

Step2. 

We have to create root view  on top of the database table. 

 

And we have to create data definition for change log also. 

 

 

Step 3. 

for the basic data definition we have create on metadata extension for front end display. 

 

@Metadata.layer:#CORE 

annotate entity zgiri_i_empl_details 

with  

{ 

@UI.facet: [  

{  

id: 'object', 

label: 'Basic Data', 

type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE, 

purpose: #STANDARD, 

position: 10 }] 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Id' , position: 10 }] 

@UI.identification: [{ label: 'Id' , position: 10 }] 

Id; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Name' , position: 20 }] 

@UI.identification: [{ label: 'Name' , position: 20 }] 

Name; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Department' , position: 30 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'Department' , position: 30 }] 

Department; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CurrKey' , position: 40 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'CurrKey' , position: 40 }] 

CurrKey; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Salary' , position: 50 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'Salary' , position: 50 }] 

Salary; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CreatedBy' , position: 60 }] 

CreatedBy; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CreatedAt' , position: 70 }] 

CreatedAt; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'ChangedBy' , position: 80 }] 

ChangedBy; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'ChangedAt' , position: 90 }] 

ChangedAt; 

}

 

Step 4. 

 

On top of the basic view we have to behavior definition. 

 

managed implementation in class zbp_giri_i_empl_details unique; 

strict ( 2 ); 
define behavior for zgiri_i_empl_details //alias <alias_name> 

persistent table zgiri_t_emp_det 

lock master 

with additional save 

authorization master ( instance ) 

early numbering 

//etag master <field_name> 

{ 

create ( authorization : global ); 

update; 

delete; 

field ( readonly ) Id; 

mapping for zgiri_t_emp_det 

{ 

ChangedAt = changed_at; 

ChangedBy = changed_by; 

CreatedAt = created_at; 

CreatedBy = created_by; 

CurrKey = curr_key; 

Department = department; 

Id = id; 

Name = name; 

Salary = salary; 

} 

}

 

On top the consumption view i have create behavior definition for consumption view. 

 

projection; 

strict ( 2 ); 

define behavior for zgiri_c_empl //alias <alias_name> 

{ 

use create; 

use update; 

use delete; 

}

Step 5. 

On top the behavior definition we have to create service definition. 

 

@EndUserText.label: 'service definition' 

define service Zgiri_rap_scn_ser { 

expose zgiri_i_empl_details; 

}

Step 6. 

On top the service definition we have to create  service binding. 

 

Step 6. 

I'm implementing logic in this class. 

CLASS lsc_zgiri_i_empl_details DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_saver. 

PROTECTED SECTION. 

METHODS save_modified REDEFINITION. 

ENDCLASS. 

CLASS lsc_zgiri_i_empl_details IMPLEMENTATION. 

METHOD save_modified. 

DATA lt_log TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zgiri_t_ch_logs1. 

DATA lt_log1 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zgiri_t_ch_logs1. 

IF update-zgiri_i_empl_details iS NOT INITIAL. 

lt_log = CORRESPONDING #( update-zgiri_i_empl_details ). 

LOOP AT update-zgiri_i_empl_details ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_log_update>). 

ASSIGN lt_log[ id = <ls_log_update>-Id ] TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_log_u>) . 

* / NAME UPDATE......................................... 

if <ls_log_update>-%control-Name = if_abap_behv=>mk-on. 

<ls_log_u>-name = <ls_log_update>-Name. 

TRY. 

<ls_log_u>-id = cl_system_uuid=>create_uuid_x16_static( ). 

CATCH cx_uuid_error. 

"handle exception 

ENDTRY. 

APPEND <ls_log_u> TO lt_log1. 
ENDIF. 
ENDLOOP. 
INSERT zgiri_t_ch_logs1 FROM TABLE _log1. 
ENDIF. 

ENDMETHOD. 

ENDCLASS. 
CLASS lhc_zgiri_i_empl_details DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler. 

PUBLIC SECTION. 
PRIVATE SECTION. 

METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION 

IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zgiri_i_empl_details RESULT result. 

METHODS get_global_authorizations FOR GLOBAL AUTHORIZATION 

IMPORTING REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zgiri_i_empl_details RESULT result. 

METHODS earlynumbering_create FOR NUMBERING 

IMPORTING entities FOR CREATE zgiri_i_empl_details. 
ENDCLASS. 

CLASS lhc_zgiri_i_empl_details IMPLEMENTATION. 


METHOD get_instance_authorizations. 

ENDMETHOD. 

METHOD get_global_authorizations. 

ENDMETHOD. 

METHOD earlynumbering_create. 

DATA(lt_entities) = entities. 

DELETE lt_entities WHERE Id IS NOT INITIAL. 

TRY. 

cl_numberrange_runtime=>number_get( 

EXPORTING 

nr_range_nr = '01' 

object = '/DMO/TRV_M' 

quantity = CONV #( lines( lt_entities ) ) 

IMPORTING 

number = DATA(lv_latest_num) 

returncode = DATA(lv_code) 

returned_quantity = DATA(lv_qty) 

). 

CATCH cx_nr_object_not_found. 

CATCH cx_number_ranges INTO DATA(lo_error). 

LOOP AT lt_entities INTO DATA(ls_entities). 

APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

%key = ls_entities-%key ) 

TO failed-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

%key = ls_entities-%key 

%msg = lo_error ) 

TO reported-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

ENDLOOP. 

EXIT. 

ENDTRY. 

ASSERT lv_qty = lines( lt_entities ). 

* DATA: lt_travel_tech_m TYPE TABLE FOR MAPPED EARLY yi_travel_tech_m, 

* ls_travel_tech_m LIKE LINE OF lt_travel_tech_m. 

DATA(lv_curr_num) = lv_latest_num - lv_qty. 

 

LOOP AT lt_entities INTO ls_entities. 

lv_curr_num = lv_curr_num + 1. 

APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

ID = lv_curr_num ) 

TO mapped-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

ENDLOOP. 
ENDMETHOD. 
ENDCLASS.

The output. 

 

Im going to update the this value. 

Here the updated value  we can see. 

And we see in the chang log table. 

In conclusion, using a dedicated change log table provides an efficient and practical way to track data modifications without the heavy storage cost of maintaining full historical snapshots. By recording only essential metadata such as key fields, change type, user, and timestamps, it creates a lightweight yet reliable audit trail. Combined with RAP determinations during the save sequence, this approach ensures that all changes are captured before commit, enabling transparency, compliance monitoring, and easier troubleshooting. Overall, it strikes the right balance between auditability and performance, making it a smart choice for scenarios where full data history is unnecessary.

thank you.

entry.title: AUnits steps for RAP
entry.content:
Introduction:
AUnits are unit tests written by ABAP developers to test each functionality of their code. In RAP, AUnits are used to test functionalities such as validations, determinations, actions, and CRUD operations etc. Your AUnits should aim for maximum coverage of your code. It is recommended to follow TDD(Test Driven Development), where you write the test cases first and then implement the logic. This ensures that the test cases are based on the actual requirements and are not influenced by the implementation.

Reference link for TDD: https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-development-tools-user-guide/test-driven-development-with-abap-unit

Basics of AUnits:
Test classes can be either local or global. Unit tests should typically be implemented as local classes within the program object that is being tested. However, you can use global test classes to host reusable logic for unit tests across different programs. In Eclipse ADT, there is a separate environment for managing local test classes.

Reference link: https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/acquire-core-abap-skills/implementing-code-tests-with-abap-unit_b23c7a00-c2e8-406d-8969-b00db3f1fd87

Structure of test class:

*"* use this source file for your ABAP unit test classes
class ltc_zi_lfa1_2 DEFINITION FINAL for
  TESTING RISK LEVEL HARMLESS DURATION SHORT.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
  CLASS-DATA environment TYPE REF TO if_cds_test_environment.
  DATA td_zlfa TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zlfa1 with empty key.
  DATA  act_results type STANDARD TABLE OF zi_lfa1_2 WITH EMPTY KEY.
  CLASS-METHODS class_setup RAISING cx_static_check.
  CLASS-METHODS class_teardown.
  METHODS setup RAISING cx_static_check.
  METHODS prepare_testdata.
  METHODS aunit_for_cds_method FOR TESTING RAISING cx_static_check.
  ENDCLASS.

For Testing: The addition FOR TESTING is used to identify a test class. These are the classes that will be executed when you run ABAPUnit tests. I will explain further how AUnits are triggered and how to execute them.

Risk Level: 

  • CRITICAL: The test changes system settings or customizing data.
  • DANGEROUS: The test changes persistent data.
  • HARMLESS: The test does not change system settings or persistent data.

Duration:

  • SHORT: Execution time is imperceptible, expected to take only a few seconds.
  • MEDIUM: Execution time is noticeable, around a minute.
  • LONG: Execution time is very noticeable, taking more than a minute. 

Methods in Test Classes:

  • Helper Methods: Helper methods are ordinary methods of the test class. They are not called by the ABAP Unit framework. You can use helper methods to structure the code of your test methods. For example, prepare_testdata is a helper method.
  • Test Methods: Test methods are defined with the addition FORTESTING after the method name. Each test method represents one test. The ABAP Unit framework performs this test by calling the corresponding test method. Test methods must not have any parameters. In the above example, aunit_for_cds_method is your test method.

Good Practices:

  • Itâ€™s a good practice to have a separate method for each functionality, with no dependencies inside the method. Each method should be treated as a single test case.
  • Always include both positive and negative test cases.

Flow of test case:

CLASS_SETUP
This static method is executed once before the first test of the test class. Use this method for fixtures that are time-consuming to create and for which you are sure the settings will not be changed by any of the test methods. Example: Setting up a test double in the test environment.

SETUP
This instance method is called before each test of the test class. Use this method for fixtures that you want to create fresh for every test case. Example: Creating an instance of the CUT (Class Under Test).

TEARDOWN
This instance method is called after each test of the test class. Use it to undo changes made in the SETUP method. It is especially important if SETUP modifies persistent data (such as system configuration, customizing, or master data). Example: Clearing test doubles so that each test starts with fresh data.

CLASS_TEARDOWN
This static method is executed once after the last test of the test class. Use it to clean up or destroy the test environment set up in CLASS_SETUP, once all tests are completed. Example: Tearing down the overall test environment.

To run ABAP units execute ABAP Unit Test. This will trigger the test class. If you run ABAP application it will not trigger test class.

Test double framework:
As I mentioned earlier, your unit tests should check only the functionality(CUT â€“ Code Under Test) that you have written the test case for. However, in real-world scenarios, each component is usually interlinked and not standalone.

What is the issue?
To explain this, letâ€™s take an example. Suppose you are testing an instance authorization method. This method is dependent on an authorization object. If the AUTH-CHECK of the authorization object fails, the instance authorization method will also fail. This means that even if your instance authorization method is working correctly, the test could still fail due to its dependency. Ideally, the failure of a dependency should not cause your unit test to fail when you are testing the functionality of the CUT itself.

Examples of dependencies in RAP

  • Instance and global authorizations: Dependency on authorization checks.
  • SAVE / SAVE_MODIFIED methods: Dependency on function modules or BAPIs.
  • Determinations: You might use EML of another BO, making your BO dependent.
  • Validations: Your CDS view could be a dependency; if the required record is not present in the CDS view, the validation might fail. And there are many more such cases.

Solution â€” Test Double Framework
So, how do we overcome this? Instead of relying on dependencies that are beyond our control, we mock or stub these dependencies. This allows us to influence how they behave and interact during testing, thereby avoiding test case failures due to external dependencies. This approach is implemented using the Test Double Framework.

The main purpose of both mock and stub is to not to test from actual data but rather a fake data that we can configure. Because our test class will fail if its dependent on real time data as it will be different in different
environment.

  1. STUB: Stubs just provide predefined response.
  2. MOCK: You design how the interaction should be. Like if you provide this value this is how the output would be and also verify it.

I will now discuss in detail how we write ABAP Unit tests with a simple example.

Requirement:
Write a positive test case to check the validation check_country, which should throw an exception if we pass a country code with more than2characters. Also, remove the dependency on the CDS view.

Steps:
Identify CUT and dependencies
Here, I have taken a validation method as an example for testing. The CUT(Code Under Test) is the validation method, and the dependency is the CDS view. So, I will use the STUB methodology to configure the response of the CDS view.

Creation of test class
Once you create the test class, you need to add it as a friend in the local handler class (since we are testing a validation). This is necessary because all the methods of the local handler class are inside the private section and cannot be accessed directly.

Inside the test class
I have already explained the use of SETUP, CLASS_SETUP, TEARDOWN, andCLASS_TEARDOWN earlier, so I will not repeat that here.
In this example, validate_check_country is our test method. I have added a test double for the CDS view, because the validation should be tested using the mock data we provide, not the actual data.
I create the mock data and insert it, so that the CDS view returns this data. Now, when we pass parameters to the validation, we can check if we get a value in reported, since we have provided a country code with 3 characters.

Note: This is just an example program. Typically, mocking, adding mock data, and different functionalities would be implemented in separate methods. It is not a good practice to combine everything into a single method. Each method should have only one responsibility. Here, I have combined them solely to showcase the concept.

class ltc_lfa1_validation IMPLEMENTATION.
    METHOD class_setup.
      cds_environment = cl_cds_test_environment=>create( i_for_entity = 'zi_lfa1_2' ).
     ENDMETHOD.
     METHOD setup.
       CREATE object cut for testing.
       cds_encironment->clear_doubles( ).
       ENDMETHOD.
     method validate_check_country.
       data: lfa1_mock_data type STANDARD TABLE OF zlfa1.
       data(system_uuid) = cl_uuid_factory=>create_system_uuid( ).
       DATA(uuid_x16) = system_uuid->create_uuid_x16( ).
       select * FROM zi_lfa1_2 into TABLE @DATA(lt_result).
         lfa1_ock_data = VALUE#( ( 
                                  Lifnr = uuid_x16 Name1 = 'Raj' Land1 = 'Ind' ) )
       cds_environment->insert_test_data( i_data = lfa1_mock_data ).
         select * from zi_lfa1_2 into TABLE @DATA(lt_result).
           i_keys = value #( ( Lifnr = uuid_x16 ) ).
           cut-> check_country( exporting key = i_keys
                                changing failed = c_failed reported = c_reported ).
           cl_abap_unit_assert=>assert_not_initial( act = c_reported msg = 'failed' ).
       ENDMETHOD.
       method teardown.
         cds_environment->destroy( ).
         ENDMETHOD.
         METHOD class_teardown.
           cds_environment->clear_doubles( ).
           ENDMETHOD.
    ENDCLASS.

Conclusion: Writing ABAP unit test in RAP ensures that the underling business logic is robust and reliable.  Structured unit test not only improve code quality and reliability but also facilitate easier maintenance and refactoring.

entry.title: Re: ç‰©æ–™çš„ç‰¹æ®Šä¿è´¨æœŸ
entry.content:
Hello @Rim3 

Thank you for your questions about special shelf-life requirements. Below is how SAP handles material shelf life, and how we can address your one-month maximum for the P1 rule.

Batch basics for raw material A â€“ enable batch management and specify Total Shelf Life as 180 days; record Date of Manufacture (LOBM_HSDAT) and SLED (LOBM_VFDAT) on batches. Optionally, set Minimum Remaining Shelf Life to manage GR.SAP Help Portal-Supply Chain

Develop a batch search strategy specifically for P1 production components, ensuring that when producing P1, the system only selects batches that comply with the freshness rule, such as

Remaining Shelf Life (LOBM_RLZ) â‰¥ 150 days (180 âˆ’ 30), or HSDAT â‰¥ today âˆ’ 30 days using a date characteristic.
Assign the strategy so it applies only to component A in P1 (through production batch determination and, where necessary, BOM item classification, which takes priority  SAP Support Portal-Batch Determination in Producti Leave P2/P3/P4 standard â€“ donâ€™t assign the strict search strategy for those headers; theyâ€™ll accept any in-date batch. SAP Help Portal

Another helpful reference

Set up batch determination in S/4HANA Cloud (step-by-step blog). SAP Community-Set Up Batch Determination in Manufacturing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Top Reasons to Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud â€“ Blog #4 in the Series
entry.content: You are mentioning "Hybrid connectivity" as a Built-in data integration capabilities different from SDA and SDI while I was thinking it was just a concept technically based on SDA and SDI. Could you please clarify which technology "Hybrid connectivity" is referring to because I was not able to find this wording in HANA Cloud documentation on help.sap.com ?
